Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: PDF/UA identifier missing
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: PDF/UA identifier must be present in metadata (dc:identifier).
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: The PDF/UA identifier (PDF/UA-1) shall be included in the document metadata to declare conformance.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Structural parent tree: Inconsistent entry found
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Structure tree and parent tree must be consistent and synchronized.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: A conforming file must include a valid and consistent structure tree with a correct ParentTree entry.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Document is not marked as tagged
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Document must be tagged for accessibility.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Tagged PDF shall be used, and the document catalog shall include a MarkInfo dictionary with Marked = true.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: [OBJECT_NAME] object not tagged
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: All content objects must be part of a tag structure.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: All meaningful content must be contained within tagged elements in the logical structure tree.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Artifact present inside tagged content
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Artifacts should not be nested within tagged elements.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Tagged content must not include artifacts. Artifacts must be clearly outside the structure hierarchy.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Tagged content present inside an artifact
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Tagged content should not appear inside artifacts.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Tagged content shall not be embedded within artifacts. Artifacts are to be ignored by assistive tech.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Structure tree missing
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Structure tree must be present in tagged PDF.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: A structure tree is required for tagged PDF and must be properly defined in the StructTreeRoot.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘Document’ structure element found which is not a root element
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: The Document tag should be the root of the structure tree.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: The Document structure element must serve as the root of the structure tree.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘[ELEMENT_NAME]’ structure element used as root element
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Only a Document element is valid as the structure tree root.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Only the Document element is permitted as the structure tree root.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Possibly inappropriate use of a ‘[ELEMENT_NAME]’ structure element
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Element types must match standard semantic structure roles.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Standard structure types must be used correctly according to their semantic purpose.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Invalid use of a ‘[ELEMENT_NAME]’ structure element
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Elements must conform to structure type rules.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Structure elements must follow the hierarchical rules defined in the PDF/UA standard.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Possibly wrong nested ‘[ELEMENT_NAME]’ struct element into StructTreeRoot
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Nested elements must respect the structural hierarchy.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Elements must be nested logically within the StructTreeRoot following role mapping rules.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Non-standard structure type ‘[TYPE_NAME]’ is neither mapped to a standard structure type nor to another non-standard structure type
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Custom types must be mapped to known types or valid extensions.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Custom structure types must be mapped to standard types via the RoleMap.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Standard structure type ‘[TYPE_NAME]’ is remapped to ‘[TYPE_NAME]’
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Remapping standard types must preserve their meaning.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Standard types shall not be remapped to other types; remapping is restricted to custom types.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Color contrast
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Ensure sufficient contrast between foreground and background.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Documents must provide sufficient contrast between text and background for readability.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: XMP metadata missing in document
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: XMP metadata must be present and conform to schema.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Conforming PDF/UA files must contain XMP metadata, including identifier and conformance info.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Title missing in document’s XMP metadata
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Document title must be included in XMP metadata.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: The XMP metadata must include a valid document title.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Title is empty in document’s XMP metadata
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Document title must be non-empty in metadata.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Document title must not be empty in the XMP metadata.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘ViewerPreferences’ dictionary missing
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: ViewerPreferences dictionary helps enforce accessibility behavior.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: The DisplayDocTitle entry shall be set to true in the ViewerPreferences dictionary.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘DisplayDocTitle’ entry is not set
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: DisplayDocTitle should be enabled to show document title in UI.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: DisplayDocTitle is required to expose the document title in user agents.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘Suspects’ entry is set
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Suspect entries indicate unverified structure and must be removed.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: ‘Suspects’ entries shall not be present in conforming files.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘StructParents’ key missing in page
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Each page must include StructParents entry to link with structure tree.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Pages must include StructParents values for proper mapping in the parent tree.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘StructParent’ entry missing in the annotation
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Annotations must have StructParent entry to map to structure tree.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: All annotations must be included in the parent tree with valid StructParent entries.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Entry for given ‘StructParents’ not found
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Referenced StructParent must exist and map to correct structure tree node.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: StructParents and StructParent must reference valid entries in the structure tree.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Logical Reading Order
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Content must be presented in a logical reading order, enabling correct interpretation by assistive technologies.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Content shall be in logical reading order.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Characters in a text object cannot be mapped to Unicode
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: All characters must be mappable to Unicode to ensure textual content is interpretable by assistive technologies.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Text shall be Unicode-mappable.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Natural language for text object cannot be determined
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: All text objects must specify a natural language, allowing proper pronunciation and processing by screen readers.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Text objects must declare natural language.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Natural language of alternative text cannot be determined
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Alternate text associated with non-text elements must include a specified language.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Alternative text must specify natural language.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Natural language of actual text cannot be determined
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: ActualText, used to override visible text for accessibility, must have a defined language.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: ActualText must also be in the correct natural language.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Natural language of expansion text cannot be determined
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Expansion text, often used in abbreviations or acronyms, must also be tagged with a language.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Expansion text must declare natural language.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Stretchable character no tagged using ActualText
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Stretchable or decorative characters must be tagged with ActualText to convey meaning to assistive technologies.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Stretchable characters (e.g., ligatures) shall use ActualText.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Character collection in CIDFont is not compartible with character collection of internal CMap
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: CIDFonts must use character collections consistent with the internal CMap to ensure accurate text extraction and accessibility.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Fonts must support correct mapping between CID and Unicode.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: CIDToGIDMap is not embedded or incomplete in font ‘[FONT_NAME]’
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: The CIDToGIDMap must be embedded and complete to enable correct character rendering and accessibility.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Embedded fonts shall include complete mapping data.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: CMap is not embedded for font ‘[FONT_NAME]’
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: To ensure reliable character mapping, a CMap must be embedded with the font or properly referenced.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: All required font program data must be embedded.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: CIDSet is missing or incomplete for font ‘[FONT_NAME]’
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: CIDSet must declare all glyphs used in the document for subset fonts to support accessibility and validation.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: CIDSet shall be present for embedded fonts.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Glyphs missing in embedded font ‘[FONT_NAME]’
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: All glyphs referenced in the content must be present in the embedded font to ensure full accessibility.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Fonts must contain all glyphs used in the document.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Non-symbolic TrueType font ‘[FONT_NAME]’ has no cmap entries
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Non-symbolic TrueType fonts must include cmap tables for character-to-glyph mapping.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Font encoding shall be Unicode-compatible.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Encoding entry prohibited for symbolic TrueType font ‘[FONT_NAME]’
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Symbolic TrueType fonts must not specify an Encoding entry; the glyph mapping must rely solely on cmap.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Symbolic fonts must not declare Encoding entries.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Incorrect encoding is used for TrueType font ‘[FONT_NAME]’
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Fonts must use standard encoding or a valid cmap to support Unicode mapping and accessibility.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Fonts must follow encoding rules for PDF/UA.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Incorrect “Differences” array for non-symbolic TrueType font ‘[FONT_NAME]’
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: The 'Differences' array in font encoding must correctly map character codes to glyph names.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: “Differences” arrays must conform to encoding standards.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘[ELEMENT_NAME]’ element on a single page with no bounding box
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Each graphical structure element must have a bounding box defined so that assistive technologies can locate and reference it appropriately.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Graphic elements must have bounding boxes.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Alternative text missing for ‘[ELEMENT_NAME]’ structure element
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Graphical content must be accompanied by alternative text to convey its meaning to users who cannot perceive visual information.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Graphic elements must include alt text.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Caption accompanying figure missing
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Figures should be accompanied by captions or descriptive text where required, to enhance understanding for screen reader users.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Figures must have captions if needed to convey meaning.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Graphics object appears between the BT and ET operators
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Graphics must not be placed within marked text blocks (BT/ET), which are reserved for text content. Doing so disrupts semantic reading order.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Marked content sequences must follow text structure rules.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: The first heading is not on the first level
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: The logical structure must begin with a level-1 heading to reflect a proper document outline and reading order.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Document headings must begin at level 1 (<H1>) to establish a logical structure for assistive technologies. Skipping initial heading levels impairs navigability.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Numbered heading skips one ore more heading levels
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Headings must be hierarchically consistent without skipping levels to preserve navigability and structure.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Heading levels must be nested logically (e.g., H1 followed by H2, not H1 followed by H3) to reflect document hierarchy accurately for users of screen readers.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘H’ and ‘Hn’ structure elements found
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Only one of either ‘H’ or ‘Hn’ structure types should be used throughout the document to maintain consistency in heading structure.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Use of both H (generic heading) and Hn (level-specific heading like H1, H2, etc.) must be consistent. Mixed usage introduces ambiguity in the heading structure.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: More than one ‘H’ structure element inside the parent structure element
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Each parent structure element should contain only one heading to ensure semantic clarity and assistive navigation.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Each heading element (Hn) must be correctly nested and not duplicated within the same structural container. Redundant heading tags can mislead assistive technology users.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Irregular table row
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Tables must have regular structure -- each row should have the same number of columns unless spanning is explicitly defined and tagged.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Table rows must follow a consistent logical structure, where each row must have the same number of data cells or headers, unless explicitly tagged and described otherwise.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Table header cell has no associated subcells
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Each table header cell must clearly define its relationship to associated data cells using appropriate attributes (e.g., Scope, Headers).
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Table header cells (<TH> or TH tagged elements) must be explicitly associated with the data cells they describe using attributes such as /Scope, /Headers, or a structure tree.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Table headers missing
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Tables should include header rows to describe the data in each column, enhancing accessibility and navigation.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: All data tables must include appropriate header rows or columns marked with /Scope attributes so that assistive technologies can convey relationships accurately.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Table summary missing
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: A table summary should be provided to describe the table's purpose and structure for users relying on assistive technology.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Tables that require additional context must include a summary or description (often in the /Alt or /Summary attribute) to communicate structure and purpose to assistive technologies.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘LI’ structure element must be a child of ‘L’ element
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: List Item (LI) elements must be properly nested under List (L) elements to preserve semantic list structure.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: According to ISO 14289-1 Clause 7.8.5.1, a list item (LI) must be contained within a list (L) structure element. This ensures that assistive technologies can properly interpret the semantics of the list structure.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘Lbl’ and ‘LBody’ structure element must be children of ‘LI’ element
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Label (Lbl) and List Body (LBody) elements must be nested inside List Items (LI) for valid structural representation.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: As stated in Clause 7.8.5.2, each LI (list item) must include exactly one Lbl (label, e.g., bullet or number) and one LBody (the list item's content). This provides proper context and meaning to list structures for users of assistive technologies.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ID missing in ‘Note’ structure element
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Note elements must include a unique ID attribute to be referenced from annotations or content.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Each Note structure element must have a unique ID defined in its attributes. This ID is critical for referencing the note correctly from other elements such as Reference, ensuring logical associations and navigability in assistive technologies.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ID entry in ‘Note’ structure element is not unique
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Each Note element must have a unique identifier for unambiguous reference in logical structure trees.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: As mandated by Clause 7.8.6.3, IDs in Note elements must be unique throughout the document. Duplicate IDs disrupt the document's logical structure and confuse referencing elements like Reference, negatively impacting accessibility.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘Name’ missing in optional content configuration dictionary
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: A name entry must be present in the optional content configuration dictionary for user interface labeling.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Optional Content Configuration Dictionary must include a valid /Name key to identify the configuration.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Optional content configuration dictionary contains ‘AS’ key
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: The 'AS' (Usage Application) key is not allowed in PDF/UA-compliant optional content dictionaries.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: The use of /AS (Alternate State) key is not permitted as it introduces variability not compatible with accessibility requirements.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘F’ or ‘UF’ key missing in the file specification
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: File specifications must include either the File (F) or Unicode File (UF) key to define the file path or name.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: File Specification Dictionary must include either an /F or /UF entry to identify the file path or file name.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘Desc’ key missing in the file specification
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: A description (Desc) key helps assistive technologies describe the embedded file and should be included.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: The /Desc key is required in embedded file streams to describe the file for assistive technology.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Signature form field ‘[FIELD_NAME]’ does not conform to the specification
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Signature fields must adhere to the specified format and structure for accessibility and validation.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Signature fields must conform to tagging and structure rules outlined for form fields, including proper naming and logical placement.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Natural language of an alternate name of a form field ‘[FIELD_NAME]’ cannot be determined
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: All form field names must include language information to enable accurate reading by assistive technologies.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Form fields must include alternate names (/TU) with natural language values to be accessible.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Alternate field name entry missing in form field ‘[FIELD_NAME]’
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Each form field must provide a T entry and an optional TU entry for assistive technology support.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Alternate field names must be provided in the structure tree using /Alt attributes or similar.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘PrintField’ attribute missing in non-interactive form item
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Non-interactive form fields must include the PrintField attribute to define visibility in print output.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Non-interactive form fields must include the /PrintField attribute to clarify display intent.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: PDF contains a dynamic XFA form
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Dynamic XFA forms are not permitted in PDF/UA-compliant documents because they rely on non-standard behavior.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Dynamic XFA forms are disallowed because they cannot be reliably tagged for accessibility.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Security settings block assistive technologies from accessing document’s content
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: PDF/UA files must allow assistive technologies access to document content without restriction.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Security settings must not block assistive technology (e.g., screen readers) from accessing document content.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Conversion is not allowed by permission restrictions
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: PDF documents must allow content copying/conversion for accessibility tools.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Conversion permissions must not block access required by assistive technologies or remediation tools.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Document Outlines Error
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Document outlines (bookmarks) must be structured and accessible.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Outlines (bookmarks) must be structured and usable by screen readers, properly reflecting the document's structure.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Natural language of outlines can be determined
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Outline titles must specify a language so they can be accurately read by assistive technologies.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: All outline entries must declare their natural language using /Lang.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Semantically appropriate Page Labels
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Page labels must follow a logical and semantically appropriate order for ease of navigation.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Page labels must semantically match the visible page number for consistent navigation.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Natural language of Contents entry cannot be determined
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Annotation contents must declare the language used for assistive parsing.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: The /Contents of an annotation must include language metadata.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Alternative description missing for an annotation
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: All annotations must have an alternative text description where appropriate.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: All annotations must have an alternate description to assist non-sighted users.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Annotation is not nested inside an ‘Annot’ structure element
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Annotations must be included in the structure tree within an appropriate container.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: All annotations must be nested inside a valid /Annot structure element.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: An annotation with subtype undefined in ISO 32000 does not meet 7.18.1
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Only annotations defined in the standard may be used in PDF/UA.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Annotations using undefined subtypes are non-conforming.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: An annotation of subtype TrapNet exists
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: TrapNet annotations are not supported in accessible PDF.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Annotations with subtype TrapNet are deprecated and not allowed.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Tab order entry in page with annotations not set to ‘S’ (Structure)
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Tab order must be set to 'S' to enforce a logical navigation path.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Annotation tab order must be explicitly set to S (Structure).

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘Widget’ annotation not nested inside a ‘Form’ structure element
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Widgets must be logically tagged in the structure tree under form fields.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Widget annotations must be nested inside a /Form structure element.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: ‘Link’ annotation is not nested inside a ‘Link’ structure element
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Link annotations must be tagged within Link structure elements to expose purpose.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Link annotations must be nested within a /Link structure element.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: CT key is missing from the media clip data dictionary
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Media annotations must specify content type using CT key.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Rich media annotations must include a CT key in the media clip dictionary.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Alt key is missing from the media clip data dictionary
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Alternate text (Alt) must be included for media annotations to aid accessibility.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Media content must include alternate text (/Alt) for accessibility.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: File attachment annotation. ‘F’ or ‘UF’ key missing in file specification
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Attached files must specify file names using F or UF keys.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Attached files must specify /F or /UF keys to identify their name.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: File attachment annotation. ‘Desc’ key missing in file specification
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Description key should be provided to clarify the file attachment's purpose.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: The /Desc key is required to explain the file to assistive tech.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: A PrinterMark annotation is included in logical structure
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Printer marks should not be included in the structure tree; they are visual artifacts only.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Printer mark annotations must not appear in the logical structure.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: The appearance stream of a PrinterMark annotation is not marked as Artifact
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Printer marks must be designated as artifacts so that they are skipped by assistive tech.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Printer mark appearance streams must be designated as /Artifact.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Actions were found. Need to check actions according to specification PDF/UA manually
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: All actions in PDF/UA must meet accessibility and navigation requirements.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Actions (e.g., JavaScript or GoTo) must be checked manually to ensure they do not interfere with accessibility or introduce barriers.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: Reference XObject shall not be used in conforming PDF/UA file
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Reference XObjects are not allowed as they are not reliably interpreted by assistive technologies.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Reference XObjects cannot be used because their content is not accessible to assistive technologies.

Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Message: The content of Form XObject isn’t incorporated into structure elements
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.ISO 32000-2 Reference Description: Content within Form XObjects must be tagged and included in the structure tree to ensure accessibility.
Aspose PDF-UA Complinace Test.Clause Description: Form XObject content must be included in the structure tree to be perceivable and navigable.

Clause Mapping.Description: Tagged PDF: general structure and compliance rules
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Defines overarching requirements for Tagged PDF including structural rules, tagging integrity, role maps, and semantic clarity to ensure logical structure. Tools: PAC, CommonLook, Adobe Acrobat Preflight.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: What is the role of general structure rules in PDF/UA compliance?; How does ISO 32000-2 Clause 14.8 affect PDF tagging practices?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: How to structure a PDF document to meet Clause 14.8?; Steps to implement compliant tag structures across document types.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Testing and Validation: What tools verify Clause 14.8 structure compliance?; How to interpret structure tree test results?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: What semantic rules apply under Clause 14.8?; Best practices for applying structure element roles.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: How does Clause 14.8 map to WCAG?; What are the crosswalk implications of PDF/UA and ISO 32000-2?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tools-Specific Guidance: How to check Clause 14.8 structure in CommonLook?; Which PAC 2024 feature targets general structure rules?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Training, Checklists, and Best P: What checklist items correspond to Clause 14.8?; List best practices for tagged PDF structure compliance.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Error Interpretation: What does 'untagged content' mean in Clause 14.8 errors?; How to resolve logical structure root issues?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Advanced and Edge Cases: How does Clause 14.8 handle multilingual PDFs?; Tagging best practices for long complex documents.

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Specifies tagging mandates such as inclusion of a structure tree, root entry, and namespace. Tools: Acrobat, axesPDF QuickFix, PDF Accessibility Checker.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: Why is document tagging required for PDF accessibility?; What are the implications of missing tag structures?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: How to manually tag untagged content?; How to verify a document meets Clause 14.8.1 tagging requirements?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Testing and Validation: How to test that all document content is tagged?; What validators confirm compliance with Clause 14.8.1?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: What are common structure elements used for document tagging?; How to apply correct semantic roles in PDFs?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Reading Order and Flow: How does tagging relate to reading order in PDFs?; Techniques to align tags with reading order.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Is Clause 14.8.1 aligned with WCAG success criteria?; Mapping ISO 32000-2 to PDF/UA tagging guidance.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tools-Specific Guidance: Using Acrobat’s Tags panel for 14.8.1 compliance; Automating tag checks with axesPDF or CommonLook.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Training, Checklists, and Best P: Checklist for validating full document tagging; Best practices for maintaining logical document tags.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Error Interpretation: What does a 'tagged content missing' error mean?; How to fix invalid or misapplied tags?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Advanced and Edge Cases: Edge cases for scanned documents with auto-tagging; Handling embedded objects in tagged structure trees.

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Focuses on how tagged content and artifacts are handled distinctly; prohibits blending content types. Techniques: Mark artifacts correctly in content streams.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: Why must artifacts be excluded from the tag tree?; What defines a valid tag versus artifact in ISO 32000-2?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: How to correctly identify and mark artifacts in Acrobat Pro?; Steps to remove non-content elements from the tag tree.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Testing and Validation: How to test for proper artifact designation?; Which test tools highlight tagging violations for artifacts?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: How to tag decorative vs meaningful content?; What semantic conflicts can arise in artifact tagging?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Does artifact handling relate to any WCAG techniques?; Map Clause 14.8.2 to PDF/UA test conditions.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tools-Specific Guidance: How does PAC 2024 handle artifacts?; Identifying misplaced tags using Adobe Acrobat Pro.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Training, Checklists, and Best P: Checklist for artifact testing in PDFs; Best practices for excluding non-structural content.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Error Interpretation: What causes 'artifact incorrectly tagged' errors?; How to diagnose tag tree conflicts with artifacts?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Advanced and Edge Cases: Tagging footnotes or floating annotations; Excluding header/footer elements from content tree.

Clause Mapping.Description: Prohibition of artifacts inside tags and vice versa
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Requires strict separation: artifacts must not appear within tagged content and vice versa. Ensure proper use of /Artifact in PDF syntax.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: What is the impact of placing artifacts inside tags?; Why should artifacts be separated from the content tree?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Use PDF remediation tools to remove artifacts from tag tree.; Reassign decorative elements correctly.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Mandates Unicode-compliant text to ensure interoperability and assistive technology readability. Apply Unicode mapping using font encoding techniques.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: What are Unicode text requirements for accessible PDFs?; Why is Unicode essential for screen reader support?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Use Unicode-compliant fonts.; Apply Unicode values using tagging tools (e.g., PAC, CommonLook).
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Enforces accurate mapping between characters and Unicode values. Confirm with font tools or PAC 2021's font mapping analysis.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: Explain Unicode mapping for characters.; What role does 14.8.2.4.2 play in internationalization?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Validate character encoding maps in Acrobat Pro.; Use Unicode CMap tables where applicable.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Describes acceptable standard and custom structure elements. Use role maps and ensure consistency across document structure.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: What are standard and custom structure elements in PDFs?; How do structure elements influence screen reader behavior?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Apply standard tags in Adobe Acrobat or CommonLook.; For custom tags, define them in the RoleMap.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Description: Use of headings and heading consistency
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Requires consistent heading use (e.g., H1, H2 hierarchy). Check with structure tree viewers or Acrobat's tags pane.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: Why is heading consistency important in accessible documents?; What constitutes a proper heading hierarchy?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Ensure heading tags (H1â€“H6) follow a sequence.; Fix broken heading order using accessibility checkers.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Establishes proper tagging of figures, tables, and lists. Apply tags like <Figure>, <L>, <LI>, <Table>. Verify with screen reader simulation.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: How should lists, tables, and figures be tagged?; What are common errors in complex structure tagging?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Use List, Lbl, and LBody tags properly.; Label tables with <Table> and provide <TH>/<TD>.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Specifies that tables must include headers (<TH>) associated with data cells. Tools: axesPDF, Adobe Acrobat, screen reader testing.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: Explain proper table structure tagging per 14.8.4.6.; How are headers associated with data cells?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Tag tables with <Table>, <TR>, <TH>, and <TD>; Use scope or headers attributes properly.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Advanced and Edge Cases: Tables with merged cells or nested tables

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Mandates correct role mapping for custom tags to standard roles. Verify in structure tree's RoleMap entry.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: What is role mapping in PDF tagging?; When do you use custom role maps?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Define custom role mappings using RoleMap dictionary.; Check mappings against standard roles.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Outlines constraints on how structure trees must be built—valid parents/children, completeness. Validate with PAC or Acrobat Preflight.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: What are structure tree constraints?; Why must the structure tree be hierarchical and logical?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Validate structure tree in PAC 2021.; Use Acrobat's Reading Order tool to correct nesting.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Requires XMP metadata embedded for document title, author, language. Tools: Acrobat's document properties, ExifTool.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: What is XMP metadata?; How does it relate to accessibility metadata?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Add metadata using Acrobatâ€™s Document Properties.; Embed XMP using XML editors if needed.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Defines the document information dictionary including title, author, subject, and keywords. Required for consistent metadata handling and discoverability by assistive technologies and cataloging systems.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: Explain document info dictionary fields.; How are they validated for conformance?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Use Acrobat's File > Properties > Description tab.; Fill Title, Author, Subject, Keywords.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Mandates general tagging of metadata in a PDF for document-level accessibility; includes authoring details and creation/modification timestamps.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: What is general metadata tagging in PDF/UA?; Why is standardized metadata important?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Tag metadata with correct property values.; Use Acrobat Pro Preflight > PDF/UA profile.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Specifies how language attributes must be applied to tagged text to support proper pronunciation, translation, and processing by screen readers. Use lang attributes in tags (e.g., /Lang).
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: Why must language be specified in tagged content?; How does it improve assistive tech support?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Set language tags using Acrobat's Tags pane.; Add Lang entry to the document root.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Describes logical reading order requirements; ensures content is presented in a sequence that aligns with intended user understanding. Verified using accessibility checkers and screen reader previews.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: General Remediation Understandin: What does logical reading order entail?; Why is reading order a fundamental requirement?
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Remediation Techniques & How-To: Tag content in logical order using the Reading Order tool.; Validate with screen reader testing.
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Tagging Structure and Semantics: Use Tag pane in Acrobat; Validate role maps
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Metadata, Navigation, Document S: Tag logical order via structure tree
Clause Mapping.Prompt: Standards Crosswalks and Mapping: Map to PDF/UA-1; Compare to WCAG 1.3

Clause Mapping.Description: Use of ActualText and alternate text for accessibility
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Specifies use of /ActualText and /Alt text for non-textual elements, such as symbols and images, to improve comprehension for screen reader users.
Establishes structure and required keys for annotation dictionaries to ensure all annotations are programmatically and semantically interpretable.
Outlines PrinterMark annotation rules, including exclusion from logical structure and ensuring they do not interfere with screen readers.
Defines technical specifications for interactive form fields, including tagging, form field naming, and roles for accessibility APIs.

Clause Mapping.Description: Field types and appearance (e.g., Title, TU, T)
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Covers form field types (e.g., text, checkboxes) and accessibility properties (e.g., Title, TU, T) to facilitate assistive technology interpretation.
Requires that /DisplayDocTitle flag is set for screen readers to prioritize document title over filename in presentation.
Ensures correct CIDFont and CMap mappings for Unicode text rendering and assistive technology compatibility.
Embedded font constraints ensure fonts are fully embedded and accessible to assistive technologies. Tools: Adobe Acrobat Preflight, PAC 3.
Encoding and character mapping must ensure correct interpretation of glyphs. Use Unicode mappings. Tools: CommonLook PDF Validator.
Unicode and text extraction rules guide how text is extracted/read. Ensure proper ToUnicode maps. Tools: PDF Accessibility Checker (PAC), Adobe Acrobat.
Outlines and bookmarks must follow logical document structure. Include meaningful titles and hierarchy. Tools: Acrobat, axesPDF.
Page labels must be correct and meaningful (e.g., Roman numerals for front matter). Tools: Adobe Acrobat, PDFix.
Security settings must not block assistive tech. Avoid encryption that restricts screen readers. Tools: Acrobat Security settings.
Optional content configuration (layers/visibility) must not interfere with accessibility. Tools: PDF accessibility tools with layer views.

Clause Mapping.Description: AS key prohibitions (not allowed in PDF/UA)
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: AS key (used for visibility control) is prohibited. Ensure it is not used. Tools: PDF Inspector tools.

Clause Mapping.Type: Embedded Files, Rich Media, and Digital Signatures
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: File specification dictionary must include all required keys like 'UF', 'F', and 'Desc'. Tools: PAC 3, Acrobat Preflight.

Clause Mapping.Type: Embedded Files, Rich Media, and Digital Signatures
Clause Mapping.Description: Rich media and media clip data dictionary
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Rich media data dictionary must be well-formed and accessible. Alt text and CT keys needed. Tools: Adobe Acrobat Pro.

Clause Mapping.Type: Embedded Files, Rich Media, and Digital Signatures
Clause Mapping.Description: Alternate text and CT key in media content
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Alternate text and CT key must be present for media content. Tools: Acrobat, axesPDF.

Clause Mapping.Type: Embedded Files, Rich Media, and Digital Signatures
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Alt descriptions required in media files for accessibility. Tools: CommonLook, PDFix.

Clause Mapping.Type: Embedded Files, Rich Media, and Digital Signatures
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Content references must be logically structured. Tools: Acrobat, PDF accessibility plugins.

Clause Mapping.Type: Embedded Files, Rich Media, and Digital Signatures
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: PrinterMark annotations must not appear in logical structure. Tools: PDF validators, PAC.

Clause Mapping.Type: Embedded Files, Rich Media, and Digital Signatures
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: File attachments must be tagged with proper metadata and descriptions. Tools: PAC 3, Adobe Acrobat.

Clause Mapping.Type: Embedded Files, Rich Media, and Digital Signatures
Clause Mapping.Description: Digital signature field format and tagging
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Digital signature fields must be tagged correctly and named appropriately. Tools: Adobe Acrobat.
Dynamic XFA forms are not allowed. Use static tagged PDF forms instead. Tools: Convert XFA to standard forms.
JavaScript must be reviewed for accessibility and security implications. Avoid if not needed. Tools: PDF editors.
GoTo/Launch actions must be properly tagged or avoided. Tools: Acrobat action inspector.

Defines the scope of PDF/UA-1, outlining requirements for universally accessible PDF content. Establishes that the document is intended to ensure reliable access for users of assistive technology. It applies to both authors creating compliant documents and tools processing them, ensuring content is machine-readable and semantically meaningful.

References ISO 32000-1 as the foundational technical specification for PDF structure and behavior. This clause links the accessibility standards to the core PDF format standard, ensuring that all conformance builds on established PDF behaviors and object models.

Clause Mapping.Description: Terms and definitions for accessibility concepts
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Presents standardized terms and definitions used throughout the document to support consistent interpretation. Key terms such as 'tagged PDF', 'assistive technology', 'structure elements', and 'alternate text' are clarified, which is essential for implementers.

Establishes that a conforming file must meet all the requirements listed in subsequent clauses and must include a PDF/UA identifier in its metadata. Also mandates the use of tagged PDF structure and prohibits inaccessible content. Tools: PAC 2021, CommonLook, Adobe Acrobat Pro Preflight.

Requires that PDF documents use a properly structured tag tree with standard structure types. Artifacts must be properly excluded. All content must be within the structure tree. Tools: PDFix SDK, axesPDF.

Clause Mapping.Description: Constraints on use of structure elements
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Limits use of custom or undefined structure types unless mapped correctly using a RoleMap dictionary. Ensures consistent semantics and interpretable document structure for assistive technologies.

Clause Mapping.Description: Use of annotations in accessible documents
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Annotations must be tagged and include alternate descriptions. Annotations should be navigable and not disrupt the reading order. Validation using screen readers and PAC tool recommended.

Interactive features like JavaScript and named actions must not interfere with accessibility. Prohibits actions that disrupt navigation. Advises against timed responses or complex interactive scripts without alternatives.
Fonts must be embedded and Unicode-compliant to ensure accurate text extraction and pronunciation by assistive technologies. Tools: Acrobat Preflight font checks, Callas pdfToolbox.
Ensures color and contrast support for visual clarity. Requires text and graphics to meet WCAG 2.0 Level AA contrast ratios. Tools: Colour Contrast Analyser, axe Accessibility.
Interactive forms must be tagged, have labels, tooltips, and use logical navigation order. Requires field metadata and avoids script-dependent input. Testing with assistive technologies recommended.
Requires metadata fields such as Title, Author, Language, and PDF/UA identifier. Ensures document discoverability and accurate rendering. Set via XMP metadata or tools like Acrobat or pdfaPilot.
Optional content and XObjects must be marked as artifacts if not tagged. Prohibits content that affects logical structure or reading order. Tools: PAC 2021 artifact checker.

Reading order must match visual layout and be semantically accurate. Structure tree must reflect logical flow of content. Testing using screen readers (NVDA, JAWS) and manual tag inspection is required.

Clause Mapping.Description: Security and rights management for accessibility
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Content must not be encrypted in ways that restrict screen readers. Security settings must allow content extraction. Validation via Acrobat security settings or Preflight tools.
Multimedia elements must include captions and audio descriptions. Scripts must not inhibit accessibility or automatic navigation. Tools: Able Player, YouTube with captions, Acrobat video annotation.

Outlines high-level requirements that documents must meet to be declared conforming PDF/UA. Includes tagged content, logical structure, metadata presence, and use of standard structure types. Enforced by validators like PAC 2021 or axesPDF.

Clause Mapping.Description: Structure types such as P, H, L, Table, etc.
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements:
This clause mandates the use of appropriate structure types (e.g.,

, , , ) to represent semantic meaning in PDF content. These tags must accurately reflect the nature of the content to assist screen readers. Tools such as Adobe Acrobat Pro, CommonLook PDF, and PAC 2021 can verify correct structure tagging. Authors should ensure tags are applied during authoring or remediation in compliance with the ISO structure model.

Content elements must follow a correct nesting hierarchy. For example, headings must not be nested within paragraphs, and list items must be within list tags. The logical structure tree must mirror the visual and reading order. Use the Tags panel in Adobe Acrobat or accessibility checkers to verify proper nesting.

All structural elements used in the PDF must be from the standard structure type set defined by ISO 32000-1. Custom types must be mapped via RoleMap to standard types. Use PDF accessibility validation tools like PAC 2021 to detect non-standard or unmapped roles.

Clause Mapping.Description: Associating table headers with data cells
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Header cells must be correctly associated with data cells using <TH> tags and appropriate attributes such as 'Scope' or 'Headers'. This helps assistive technologies convey tabular relationships. Use Adobe Acrobat’s Table Inspector and screen reader simulators to confirm associations.

Notes must be tagged using <Note> and provided with unique IDs when referenced. Reference links should clearly point to corresponding notes to preserve document clarity and accessibility. Use structure trees and ID checking tools to ensure references are valid.

All non-text content (e.g., images, charts) must have meaningful alternative text via /Alt attributes. Decorative items must be marked as artifacts. Use Acrobat’s Set Alternate Text tool or CommonLook Validator to ensure compliance.

Lists must be structured using <L>, <LI>, <Lbl>, and <LBody> elements. Proper labeling improves navigation and comprehension for screen reader users. Use Acrobat Pro’s tag tree or automated testing tools to verify structural integrity.

Annotations must include necessary metadata (e.g., Alt text) and be placed in appropriate tag containers. Avoid untagged or incorrectly structured annotations. Use tools that inspect PDF object properties for validation.

Multimedia elements must have synchronized alternatives such as captions and transcripts. Ensure proper tagging and artifact exclusion for assistive compatibility. Use accessibility tools like Able Player and multimedia validators to test playback accessibility.
Navigation elements such as bookmarks and links must be descriptive and correctly tagged. Use /Link structure elements with appropriate /Alt text or tooltips. Test with screen readers for usability.

The PDF must contain a complete structure tree representing document semantics. RoleMap entries must map custom tags to standard roles. Tools like PAC 2021 and Acrobat’s Tags panel are essential for inspection and validation.
All page content must be within the tag tree. Unmarked content should be remediated using tagging tools. Verify with accessibility checkers and the Order and Tags pane in Acrobat.

Clause Mapping.Description: Association of elements to content items
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: Elements in the structure tree must be associated with content items such as marked content sequences or object references. This ensures that content is tagged and interpretable by assistive technologies. Use Acrobat's Content panel or CommonLook PDF validator to verify proper associations.

Artifacts must be marked so they are ignored by assistive technologies (e.g., decorative lines, headers). Use tools like PAC 2021 or CommonLook to verify that artifacts are correctly flagged with /Artifact.

All text elements must have a natural language (lang) attribute to aid pronunciation and interpretation. Assign language using the document properties in Acrobat or set lang attributes at the tag level for multilingual documents.
Non-text content (e.g., images) must include text alternatives. Use tags such as /Alt to provide descriptions. Tools like CommonLook, axesPDF, or Equidox can assist in identifying missing alt text.
Text must be mappable to Unicode for accurate interpretation. Ensure fonts have valid Unicode maps and verify using callas pdfGoHTML or the PDF Accessibility Checker (PAC 2021).

Fonts and glyphs must support text extraction. Embedding fonts is required, and mappings must support search and copy functions. Check font embedding and glyph integrity using Adobe Preflight or callas pdfToolbox.

ActualText and ExpansionText attributes provide accessible alternatives for abbreviated or symbolic content. Use tagging tools to include /ActualText for screen readers. Validate with PAC 2021 or Adobe Acrobat's accessibility checker.
Tables must be properly tagged with Table, TR, TH, and TD elements, and relationships between header and data cells must be explicit. Use Acrobat Pro or axesPDF for table tag remediation.

Clause Mapping.Description: Form fields and dynamic XFA handling
Clause Mapping.Overview and Requirements: All form fields must be tagged, have tooltips, and be included in the structure tree. XFA forms are not allowed. Use Acrobat's Prepare Form tool and verify with CommonLook PDF validator.

Embedded content such as multimedia or file attachments must be tagged appropriately and provide text alternatives. Use structure elements such as /Figure or /Object with /Alt or /ActualText attributes.

Prompt Taxonomy.Description: Prompts that seek high-level clarification or conceptual guidance on ISO clauses, accessibility rules, or terminology.
Prompts that ask for specific steps, fixes, or approaches to resolve accessibility issues flagged in tools or audits.
Prompts focused on checking compliance, using accessibility testing tools, or validating content against PDF/UA conformance.
Prompts that address structural tagging, proper element use, nesting, and semantic mapping.
Prompts about specific types of content—like text, images, forms, media, tables, or links—and how to make them accessible.
Prompts that address document-level elements such as metadata, document titles, bookmarks, outlines, and security settings.
Prompts that deal specifically with logical reading order, tab order, visual vs. semantic structure, and user navigation.
Prompts that request mappings between Aspose errors, ISO clauses, WCAG checkpoints, and remediation actions.
Prompts focused on using popular remediation or testing tools (e.g., Adobe Acrobat, CommonLook, axesPDF, PAC 2021, ABBYY).
Prompts designed to generate training content, cheat sheets, QA checklists, or job aids for teams and auditors.
Prompts to interpret compliance test error messages from tools like Aspose, PAC, Adobe Preflight, and PDF Accessibility Checker.
Prompts concerning multilingual content, language declarations, and international accessibility compliance.
